instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3437 Fan spinning problem
threads.message:
This board is back after a few months, with a new Q6060 it was working fine and now the problem is back, we have tried different Q6060 and the problem is persistent, any ideas? 
the voltages:
Pin1: 5.1v
Pin2: 1.63v
Pin3: 4,62v

This was the original thread:
[url]https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/14618-solved-820-3437-a-fan-spinning-very-fast[/url]

threads.title: 820-3437 Fan spinning problem
threads.message: Directly fast on startup? ASD error? SMC_FAN_0_CTL voltage?

threads.title: 820-3437 Fan spinning problem
threads.message:
No Title

SMC_FAN_0_CTL is 3.3v and ASD errors are attached in the picture and yes directly on startup

threads.title: 820-3437 Fan spinning problem
threads.message: Diode mode on SMC_FAN_0_CTL fan disconnected of course.

threads.title: 820-3437 Fan spinning problem
threads.message: It's 0 between SMC_FAN_0_CTL and ground in diode mode.

threads.title: 820-3437 Fan spinning problem
threads.message: Well there shouldn't be a short to GND there! Not much on that line besides the SMC that can cause this.
